channel.title: Amiga Os on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in Amiga Os on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Operating In Obscurity
item.description: [whitebox] [big]Today in Tedium: Operating systems are the cockroaches of the digital revolution. They’re everywhere, hiding in low-level crevices, and most of the time, you don’t really notice when they’re there—except, of course, when they draw attention to themselves. (Cough, cough Windows 8 cough.) But most of those operating systems fade from view—except when they don’t. Case in point: The company Arca Noae claims it’s about to launch a brand-new version of IBM’s coulda-been ‘90s contender, OS/2.
